con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions name="EntityService" targetNamespace="http://entity.ws.soap.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:ns1="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:tns="http://entity.ws.soap.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <wsdl:documentation>The Chrome River Entity Web Service fulfills requests from our customers to create/update/delete entity records.
To get started with Entity Web Service, please submit a Chrome River Help Desk ticket. Our Implementation team will work with you to get everything set up and running.
To access this service, use this Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file to generate the required client proxy classes: https://api.chromeriver.com/ws_EntityV1?wsdl
Please also read this documentation to understand what it does and how to properly prepare requests.
Logging In
Each request to access this service must be authenticated via either login credentials or a session token. The Login Web Service may be used to submit the user's login information in a request consisting of companyID, userID, and password. The user will receive a token to submit with subsequent requests to other Chrome River Web Services, eliminating the need to provide the login information again.
While it is also possible to submit login information directly via the header of the Entity Web Service, it is recommended that customers use the Login Web Service first to obtain a session token, and then submit this token in each subsequent request to the Entity Service.
Chrome River Entity Web Service Overview
Please use the following description as a reference, but do not hesitate to contact us at support@chromeriver.com should you run into problems or have questions.
There are five operations exposed via the Entity Web Service: createEntity, updateEntity, deleteEntity, createEntityType and updateEntityType. Each call either creates or updates or deletes a single entity or entityType record in the Chrome River system for the requesting customer.
Each call to one of the five operations (createEntity, updateEntity, deleteEntity, createEntityType, updateEntityType) requires two input objects: the LoginCredentials object and Entity/EntityType object. The former contains either the full login information or a session token, while the latter contains input parameter values (those that are optional may be omitted) required to complete the request.
The service responds to a request with the MessageEnvelope object. In the event of a successful outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.SUCCESS." In the event of a failed outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.FAIL," along with a list of ValidationError objects detailing why the request was not completed successfully.
Each ValidationError contains three pieces of information: the error code, the name of the error code, and a brief message explaining the error. For example, in a createEntity request, if the incoming entityTypeCode and entityCode already point to an existing entity in our system, the response envelope will contain the ValidationError with error code "500," the name "ObjectExists," and the message "Entity already exists.
It is recommended that each error message be processed, the input be corrected, and the request be retried at a later time. Also note that each request is first authenticated before further processing, so that if the token or the login credentials are not valid, only a "9000/InvalidLogin" error or a "9001/InvalidSession" error will be returned in the response. For more information about login errors, please see the WSDL documentation for the Login Web Service.
For the createEntity ,updateEntity and deleteEntity operations, not all of the parameters for the input Entity object are required in all cases. If a parameter is not required, it may be omitted from the request. In such a case, it will take on the default value (null/empty value, unless otherwise specified) in our system in a createEntity and updateEntity call.
Entity Web Service - Parameters and Validation Rules
Here are validation rules for the createEntity ,updateEntity and deleteEntity operations that are unrelated to the fields of the input Entity object.
Here are the parameters of the input Entity object for the createEntity , updateEntity and deleteEntity operations and associated validation rules.
========= Field: entityCode Description: code of the entity.
Field: entityName Description: name of the entity.
Field: entityTypeCode Description: code of the entity type. --- Constraint: in createEntity call, must not refer to an existing entity Violation: input value refers to an existing entity Error: 500/ObjectExists --- Constraint: in updateEntity call, must refer to an existing entity Violation: input value does not refer to an existing entity Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: in deleteEntity call, must refer to an existing entity Violation: input value does not refer to an existing entity Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField ---
Below are the parameters of the input EntityType object for the createEntityType and updateEntityType operations.
========= Field: EntityTypeCode Description: Entity type code. Format: 1-32 characters. --- Constraint: in createEntityType call, must not refer to an existing EntityType Violation: input value refers to an existing EntityType Error: 500/ObjectExists --- Constraint: in updateEntityType call, must refer to an existing EntityType Violation: input value does not refer to an existing EntityType Error: 501/ObjectMissing --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: length Violation: input value must be greater or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 32 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength ========= Field: EntityTypeDescription Description: Entity type description Format: 1-100 characters --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: length Violation: input value must be greater or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 100 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength ========= Field: EntityTypeName Description: Entity type name Format: 1-50 characters --- Constraint: required Violation: missing from input, or value is the empty string Error: 1004/EmptyField --- Constraint: length Violation: input value must be greater or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 50 characters Error: 1005/IncorrectLength ========= Field: LoadOnLogin Description: Enables whether Entity Type should be cached. Valid entries are: 0: Entity Type should not be cached 1: Entity Type should be loaded on page load(cache load) Defaults to 1(Entity Type should be loaded on page load). --- Violation: input value must be either 0 or 1 Error: 2012/Invalid Entity Type LoadOnLogin input =========
For more information about this and other Chrome River Web Services, please contact us at support@chromeriver.com.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="unqualified" targetNamespace="http://entity.ws.soap.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:complexType name="Payload"> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Entity"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:Payload"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="entityTypeCode" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="entityCode" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="entityName" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="extraData1" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="extraData2" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sortOrder" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="loginCredentials"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="token" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="user" type="tns:userLoginInfo"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="userLoginInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="companyId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="userId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="password" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="MessageEnvelope"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="statusCode" type="tns:returnStatusCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sessionId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="validationError" type="tns:ValidationError"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="webServicePayload" type="tns:Payload"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ValidationError"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="name" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="message" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EntityType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:Payload"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="EntityTypeCode" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="EntityTypeName" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="EntityTypeDescription" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="LoadOnLogin" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="returnStatusCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="FAIL"/> <xs:enumeration value="SUCCESS"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:element name="credentials" nillable="true" type="tns:loginCredentials"/> <xs:element name="inEntityCreate" nillable="true" type="tns:Entity"/> <xs:element name="createEntityResponse" nillable="true" type="tns:MessageEnvelope"/> <xs:element name="inEntityUpdate" nillable="true" type="tns:Entity"/> <xs:element name="updateEntityResponse" nillable="true" type="tns:MessageEnvelope"/> <xs:element name="inEntityDelete" nillable="true" type="tns:Entity"/> <xs:element name="deleteEntityResponse" nillable="true" type="tns:MessageEnvelope"/> <xs:element name="inEntityTypeCreate" nillable="true" type="tns:EntityType"/> <xs:element name="createEntityTypeResponse" nillable="true" type="tns:MessageEnvelope"/> <xs:element name="inEntityTypeUpdate" nillable="true" type="tns:EntityType"/> <xs:element name="updateEntityTypeResponse" nillable="true" type="tns:MessageEnvelope"/> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="createEntityType"> <wsdl:part element="tns:inEntityTypeCreate" name="inEntityTypeCreate"></wsdl:part> <wsdl:part element="tns:credentials" name="credentials"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="deleteEntity"> <wsdl:part element="tns:inEntityDelete" name="inEntityDelete"></wsdl:part> <wsdl:part element="tns:credentials" name="credentials"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="updateEntity"> <wsdl:part element="tns:inEntityUpdate" name="inEntityUpdate"></wsdl:part> <wsdl:part element="tns:credentials" name="credentials"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="createEntityResponse"> <wsdl:part element="tns:createEntityResponse" name="createEntityResponse"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="deleteEntityResponse"> <wsdl:part element="tns:deleteEntityResponse" name="deleteEntityResponse"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="createEntityTypeResponse"> <wsdl:part element="tns:createEntityTypeResponse" name="createEntityTypeResponse"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="updateEntityResponse"> <wsdl:part element="tns:updateEntityResponse" name="updateEntityResponse"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="createEntity"> <wsdl:part element="tns:inEntityCreate" name="inEntityCreate"></wsdl:part> <wsdl:part element="tns:credentials" name="credentials"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="updateEntityTypeResponse"> <wsdl:part element="tns:updateEntityTypeResponse" name="updateEntityTypeResponse"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="updateEntityType"> <wsdl:part element="tns:inEntityTypeUpdate" name="inEntityTypeUpdate"></wsdl:part> <wsdl:part element="tns:credentials" name="credentials"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="EntityService"> <wsdl:operation name="createEntity"> <wsdl:input message="tns:createEntity" name="createEntity"></wsdl:input> <wsdl:output message="tns:createEntityResponse" name="createEntityResponse"></wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="updateEntity"> <wsdl:input message="tns:updateEntity" name="updateEntity"></wsdl:input> <wsdl:output message="tns:updateEntityResponse" name="updateEntityResponse"></wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="deleteEntity"> <wsdl:input message="tns:deleteEntity" name="deleteEntity"></wsdl:input> <wsdl:output message="tns:deleteEntityResponse" name="deleteEntityResponse"></wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="createEntityType"> <wsdl:input message="tns:createEntityType" name="createEntityType"></wsdl:input> <wsdl:output message="tns:createEntityTypeResponse" name="createEntityTypeResponse"></wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="updateEntityType"> <wsdl:input message="tns:updateEntityType" name="updateEntityType"></wsdl:input> <wsdl:output message="tns:updateEntityTypeResponse" name="updateEntityTypeResponse"></wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="EntityServiceSoapBinding" type="tns:EntityService"> <soap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="createEntity"> <soap:operation soapAction="" style="document"/> <wsdl:input name="createEntity"> <soap:header message="tns:createEntity" part="credentials" use="literal"></soap:header> <soap:body parts="inEntityCreate" use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="createEntityResponse"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="updateEntity"> <soap:operation soapAction="" style="document"/> <wsdl:input name="updateEntity"> <soap:header message="tns:updateEntity" part="credentials" use="literal"></soap:header> <soap:body parts="inEntityUpdate" use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="updateEntityResponse"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="deleteEntity"> <soap:operation soapAction="" style="document"/> <wsdl:input name="deleteEntity"> <soap:header message="tns:deleteEntity" part="credentials" use="literal"></soap:header> <soap:body parts="inEntityDelete" use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="deleteEntityResponse"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="createEntityType"> <soap:operation soapAction="" style="document"/> <wsdl:input name="createEntityType"> <soap:header message="tns:createEntityType" part="credentials" use="literal"></soap:header> <soap:body parts="inEntityTypeCreate" use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="createEntityTypeResponse"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="updateEntityType"> <soap:operation soapAction="" style="document"/> <wsdl:input name="updateEntityType"> <soap:header message="tns:updateEntityType" part="credentials" use="literal"></soap:header> <soap:body parts="inEntityTypeUpdate" use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="updateEntityTypeResponse"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="EntityService"> <wsdl:port binding="tns:EntityServiceSoapBinding" name="EntityServicePort"> <soap:address location="https://staging-api.chromeriver.com/ws_EntityV1"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>

<wsdl:definitions name="LoginService" targetNamespace="http://login.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:ns1="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:tns="http://login.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <wsdl:documentation>The Chrome River Login Web Service fulfills requests from our customers to log in to our Web Services platform.
To get started with Chrome River Web Services, please submit a Chrome River Help Desk ticket. Our Implementation team will work with you to get everything set up and running.
To access this service, use this Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file to generate the required client proxy classes: https://api.chromeriver.com/ws_LoginV1?wsdl
Please also read this documentation to understand what it does and how to properly prepare requests.
Logging In
Each request to access a Chrome River Web Service must be authenticated via either login credentials or a session token. The Login Web Service may be used to submit the user's login information in a request consisting of companyID, userID, and password. The user will receive a token to submit with subsequent requests to other Chrome River Web Services, eliminating the need to provide the login information again.
While it is also possible to submit login information directly via the header of every Chrome River Web Service, it is recommended that customers use the Login Web Service first to obtain a session token, and then submit this token in each subsequent request to the other services.
Chrome River Login Web Service Overview
Only one operation is exposed via the Login Web Service: createSession. The purpose of this operation is to submit login credentials and get in response a session token used to access other Chrome River Web Services. The token will renew each time it is used in a request. It will expire after 30 minutes of inactivity, at which point a new token must be acquired by resubmitting the login credentials to this service.
Each call to the createSession operation requires the LoginCredentials input object, which contains two parameters: token and user. This object is actually a shared input across all Chrome River Web Services. In services other than the Login Service, the token parameter is used to submit the session ID along with the rest of the request. In the Login Service, use the user parameter to set the required login credentials: companyID, userID, and password.
The service responds to a request with the MessageEnvelope object. In the event of a successful outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.SUCCESS," along with a session token in the sessionID field. In the event of a failed outcome, the envelope will contain the statusCode "ReturnStatusCode.FAIL," along with a list of ValidationError objects detailing why the request was not successful. Each ValidationError contains three pieces of information: the error code, the name of the error code, and a brief message explaining the error.
In the Login Service there are two possible error scenarios:
1. Invalid Login ===================== Description: The credentials provided do not match a valid record in our system. Error Code: 9000 Error Name: InvalidLogin Error Message: Invalid login information Resolution: Double-check that the companyID, userID, and password match those provided to you previously by Chrome River.
2. Invalid Session ===================== Description: The token provided is not valid or has expired. Error Code: 9001 Error Name: InvalidSession Error Message: No session, or session no longer valid. Resolution: Log in again with full credentials to obtain a new and valid session token.
For more information about this and other Chrome River Web Services, please contact us at support@chromeriver.com.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="unqualified" targetNamespace="http://login.ws.chromeriver.com/" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:complexType name="loginCredentials"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="token" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="user" type="tns:userLoginInfo"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="userLoginInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="companyId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="userId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="password" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="MessageEnvelope"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="statusCode" type="tns:returnStatusCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sessionId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="validationError" type="tns:ValidationError"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="webServicePayload" type="tns:Payload"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ValidationError"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="name" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="message" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Payload"> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="returnStatusCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="FAIL"/> <xs:enumeration value="SUCCESS"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:element name="loginCredentials" nillable="true" type="tns:loginCredentials"/> <xs:element name="createSessionResponse" nillable="true" type="tns:MessageEnvelope"/> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="createSessionResponse"> <wsdl:part element="tns:createSessionResponse" name="createSessionResponse"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="createSession"> <wsdl:part element="tns:loginCredentials" name="loginCredentials"></wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="Login"> <wsdl:operation name="createSession"> <wsdl:input message="tns:createSession" name="createSession"></wsdl:input> <wsdl:output message="tns:createSessionResponse" name="createSessionResponse"></wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="LoginServiceSoapBinding" type="tns:Login"> <soap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="createSession"> <soap:operation soapAction="" style="document"/> <wsdl:input name="createSession"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="createSessionResponse"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="LoginService"> <wsdl:port binding="tns:LoginServiceSoapBinding" name="LoginPort"> <soap:address location="https://staging-api.chromeriver.com/ws_LoginV1"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>

con:configuration.content: code must not be over 32 characters in length.
description must not be over 100 characters in length.
name must not be over 50 characters in length.
Entity Code must be 1-50 characters long
Sort Order must be 1-10 characters long
Sort Order must be 1-10 characters long
description must not be over 100 characters in length.
name must not be over 50 characters in length.

con:testStep.name: deleteEntity - missing Invalid Entity Type Code

con:request.name: deleteEntity - missing Invalid Entity Type Code
